meanings.sent1: She likes to slather butter on her toast in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The chef will slather the barbecue sauce on the ribs before grilling.
meanings.sent3: He decided to slather sunscreen all over his body, looking like a shiny seal at the beach.
meanings.sent4: The artist slathered paint on the canvas, creating a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The child slathered glue on the paper, sticking on colorful shapes for an art project.

meanings.definition: A thick layer or coating of something
meanings.sent1: The cake was covered in a slather of rich chocolate frosting.
meanings.sent2: She spread a slather of cream cheese on her bagel for breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The puppy left a slather of muddy paw prints all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent4: The mountain was hidden under a slather of fluffy white snow.
meanings.sent5: The sandwich was overflowing with a slather of tangy mustard.
